meanings.definition: To specialize in a particular subfield within a larger field of study or practice.
meanings.sent1: She decided to subspecialize in cardiology after completing her general medical training.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often subspecialize in areas like neurology or oncology to provide more focused care.
meanings.sent3: The chef seemed to subspecialize in creating unique desserts that left customers amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to subspecialize in problem-solving made her an invaluable member of the team.
meanings.sent5: As a detective, he learned to subspecialize in analyzing complex crime scenes for clues.
